page.title: 01ASTON SOMERVILLE AND AREA
page.content: This is a very rural area which consists mainly of open fields, small woods and fruit orchards. It is fairly low lying with an average of only 50 metres above sea level. There are small country lanes which wind through the fields and link with the main roads outside the block. Two villages are within this area, Aston Somerville is on the Western side and Childswickham lies to the East. There is also the small hamlet of Mount Pleasant. Aston Somerville is the smaller of the two villages having a population of about 200 residing in around seventy houses. There are eleven farms in this block. The fields are used mainly for cereal crop growing and for grazing sheep and cattle. The whole area shows the traveller a very restful, pastoral scene.
